title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A timeless classic about the American Dream.
description: A story of wealth, love, and disillusionment in the Roaring Twenties.

author: George Orwell
review: A powerful dystopian novel about surveillance and control.
description: A totalitarian regime uses surveillance to control its citizens' every move.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
review: A gripping story of racial injustice in the American South.
description: The narrative explores the deeply ingrained racial prejudice in a small town.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
review: A witty and romantic exploration of social class and marriage.
description: The story of Elizabeth Bennet and her relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
review: A raw portrayal of teenage angst and rebellion.
description: A story about a disillusioned teen named Holden Caulfield who rejects the adult world.
